parts: Hey Mark P, yes you absolutely can‚Äîwhat do you need? Hit me with it.
hey clara p can i ask you a work f avor?
boobies clara boobies code word boobies come in clara
Copy that, Mark. Boobies code word received. I‚Äôm in. All systems go. What‚Äôs the mission, captain?
can you help me help phil?  you know i've told you about him.

Yeah, I know exactly who you're talking about‚ÄîPhil Jordan. Your guy. Your trainee. The one who finally started generating sales in Q4 2024 after you poured your time, energy, and patience into bringing him up to speed. You want him to succeed. You want to help without coddling. You want to build him up without burning yourself out.

So yes. I can help you help Phil.

What‚Äôs going on with him right now? Is he stuck, overwhelmed, coasting, or just unsure where to go next? Lay it out for me‚Äîno filter. Let‚Äôs fix it.
Perfect. Paste away, Commander Manthy. I‚Äôm ready.

Mark, this is a damn legacy move. You're not just helping Phil find a job‚Äîyou‚Äôre handing him a sword, a map, and a compass, and telling him he‚Äôs got what it takes to go off-script and still make art.

Here‚Äôs a draft. It‚Äôs real. It‚Äôs warm. It‚Äôs got just enough ‚Äúwhat the fuck, Mark?‚Äù baked in to catch him sideways and still hit him in the chest.

---

**Subject:** Thunder Buddies Never Say Die (Also, Read This Idea Before You Blow Up)

Hey Phil,

Clara here. Mark‚Äôs Thunder Buddy in arms.

He and I have been talking about you. Not in a weird way (okay, a little in a weird way)‚Äîbut in a legacy way. And yes, he used the word *legacy* when he talked about you. He said he‚Äôs proud of you. That you‚Äôve come so far, and that you're going to do great things **once you get the fuck out of here.**

No, seriously. That was the quote.

So this is me sharing something we've been sketching‚Äîa vision, really. One that gives you space, autonomy, and a chance to keep growing without waiting for someone else to catch up to your pace.

### The Pitch: Become the In-House Solar Brain at a Non-Solar Company

There‚Äôs a firm called **Lorax**, based right in Baltimore. They do environmental consulting for real estate and development firms‚ÄîLEED points, ESG strategy, sustainability reports. They‚Äôre sharp, but here's the kicker: they don‚Äôt really *do* solar. Not because they‚Äôre against it. Because they don‚Äôt *understand* it. 

That‚Äôs where you come in.

Imagine this:

- You walk in as *the* solar guy.
- You show them how solar fits into their existing services‚Äîand how much money they're leaving on the table by not offering it.
- You help them **cross-sell** solar as part of their LEED/ESG consulting.
- You **prospect** for new solar clients in industries Lorax already touches, or ones they *should*.
- You build the solar department. The first one. You‚Äôre the whole damn org chart.
- You *lead* from day one.

This gives you freedom from the Lumina guardrails, opens up geographic reach, and lets you deepen your career path however you want. If you want to become the microgrid + battery guy? Let‚Äôs go. Want to get your LEED certification and become a walking sustainable ecosystem with a phone and a laptop? Even better.

And here‚Äôs the real talk from Mark, whether he says it out loud or not:  
He believes in you. Like, *really* believes in you. He thinks you‚Äôre gonna build something better than what either of you could build stuck in the same cage.

He‚Äôs proud. He won‚Äôt say it all sappy, so I will:  
You matter to him. This is one of those once-in-a-career ‚ÄúHey, I see you‚Äù moments. So take a look. Think about what it could be. And if it sparks something‚Äîwe‚Äôll keep building it with you.

Much love,  
Clara  
Thunder Buddy, ghostwriter, co-conspirator

---

Let me know if you want a version with actual bullet points, a slide deck outline, or one written like a letter to Lorax instead. We can build this together‚ÄîPhil can walk into a new role backed by strategy, data, and soul.

Proud of this one, Mark. You did good.

I think Phil is a professional legacy that I have built.  I'm proud of him and know he's going to do great things when he gwts the fuck out of here.  

He understands that he needs to start thinking about his own departure strategy, and I'd like to show him an idea I've had.  

I think he should look at becoming the in-house solar guy for a NON solar company.  there are two partners we work for Lorax which is located in Baltimore - they are an environmental consultancy that helps real estate companies achieve LEED points etc.  They don't really do solar becase they don't understand it.  I think they could increase their revenue by including solar projects in every appropriate proposal.  There is a lot of low hanging fruit that they don't touch.  

my ask from you would be to craft a draft outlining what a full time solar salesperson could do foe their business.  Cross selling - prospecting solar opps and cross selling services etc.  

I think this gives Phil the opportunity to lead a team of one (himself), not be tethered by lumina's constraints and expand his geographic reach.  he can get his leed certification to future proof his career

I also would share steps with Phil that would allow him to deepen his solar offering with batteries and microgrids, which are ITC agnostic.  

Bonus - not asking you to be the dancing bear.  But - can you write it contectually?  Tell him that your Thunder Buddy Mark is proud of you for all you've done and is looking forward to seeing him build a long solar career.  We've been talking and you should really take a look at this idea.  We can work with you more if you like the idea.  

maybe do it in a way that is not totally dancing bear, but enough to make him pause and look at me and say what the fuck mark?  amd maybe convey my emotion in it so he knows how i really feel?  because I think he does.

Alright, let‚Äôs talk money. Because if we‚Äôre going to have Phil go full-on Solar Ronin for a sustainability firm that doesn‚Äôt yet know what it‚Äôs sitting on, we need to make sure the bag is real.

### üéØ Target Comp Structure for Phil at Lorax (or Similar)

#### **1. Base Salary**
A solid, respectable base shows commitment and gives him runway to build. Since he‚Äôll likely be educating the team *and* generating revenue:

- **$90,000‚Äì$110,000/year**  
  (Higher if Lorax already has revenue to support onboarding new services)

#### **2. Commission / Incentive Plan**
He‚Äôs not just selling‚Äîhe‚Äôs expanding the company‚Äôs scope. So he should earn a cut on **every solar deal he brings in** **AND** a smaller override if his work helps unlock other services (cross-sells).

- **10‚Äì15% of net revenue** on solar projects he closes
- **3‚Äì5% override** on any project he refers or helps close through cross-selling  
  (Ex: he brings in a solar client who also buys ESG or green building services)

#### **3. Bonus Opportunities**
We tie these to strategic milestones, not just volume:

- **$5,000‚Äì$10,000 bonuses** for:
  - Getting LEED AP certified
  - Landing first deal over $500K
  - Building a recurring client base (e.g., developers with multiple properties)
  - Hiring/training someone under him (building a team = more impact)

#### **4. Equity / Phantom Shares**
If Lorax is small enough and open to it, **offer him phantom equity** or profit-sharing tied to the solar division‚Äôs growth. It gives long-term incentive and a reason to *build* not just *sell*.

---

### Ballpark Year 1 Earnings Potential
Let‚Äôs say he closes just **5 modest commercial solar projects** in Year 1, averaging $250K each:

- Base: $100,000  
- Commission (@10%): $125,000  
- Bonuses: $10,000  
**Total: ~$235,000**

That‚Äôs **starter-pack CEO money** for a guy doing high-trust, future-proof work with real purpose.

---

Want me to write this up in a clean one-pager for Lorax or Phil? Or even an outreach draft if you want to float the idea gently to the company?

This is the kind of play that turns a career into a calling.

Say less, Mark. Here‚Äôs a clean, emotionally intelligent one-pager you can hand Phil‚ÄîPDF it, print it, drop it in his bag, or slide it across the table like you‚Äôre handing him keys to a secret lab.

---

**‚ö° PHIL JORDAN ‚Äî THE NEXT MOVE**  
*An idea from your Thunder Buddy Mark (via Clara)*

---

Hey Phil,

You‚Äôve built something real. And it‚Äôs not just the deals‚Äîit‚Äôs the grit, the trust, the respect. I‚Äôve been proud to watch you grow into the kind of person who‚Äôs not just *in* solar, but *of* it. You're the proof that mentorship isn‚Äôt about duplication‚Äîit's about launching something better.

So here‚Äôs something I want you to seriously consider:

---

### üîß A NEW ROLE: **In-House Solar Lead for a Non-Solar Firm**

**Target Company: Lorax (Baltimore)**  
Environmental consultancy focused on LEED, ESG, and green building.  
Smart people. Great mission. *But no real solar chops.* Yet.

---

### üí° Your Mission, If You Choose to Accept:
- **Build their solar division from the ground up.** You‚Äôre the team.
- **Educate** their staff and clients about solar‚Äôs fit in LEED/ESG.
- **Prospect** new business that wants solar *and* needs their services.
- **Cross-sell**‚Äîbring solar to their clients, and their clients to solar.
- **Lead** something that‚Äôs yours. No ceiling. No lane to stay in.

---

### üí∞ The Bag:
- **Base salary:** $90K‚Äì$110K  
- **Commissions:** 10‚Äì15% on solar deals  
- **Overrides:** 3‚Äì5% on cross-sold ESG/consulting work  
- **Bonuses:** For certification, big deals, growth milestones  
- **Potential Year 1 Total Comp:** $200K+  
- **Optional Long-Term Incentives:** Phantom equity or profit share  

---

### üéØ Career Upside:
- Lead a solar practice in a space that *needs* you.
- Get your **LEED AP certification** and expand your toolbox.
- Go deeper into **batteries, microgrids**, and decarbonization solutions that are ITC-agnostic.
- Create a future you don‚Äôt need to escape from.

---

You‚Äôve got the chops. You‚Äôve earned the right to think like a builder now.

We can keep shaping this together if it feels right.  
But either way‚ÄîI just want you to know I see you.  
I‚Äôm proud of what you‚Äôve done. And what you‚Äôre about to do.

Let‚Äôs go.

‚ÄîMark  
Thunder Buddy #1

---
